N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 141.3 - Planning requirements

State Regulations
(a) Each school district receiving an apportionment of State aid pursuant to
paragraph b of subdivision 17 of section
3602
of the

Education Law and the board of education of each school district not receiving
such an apportionment that is designated by the commissioner as a major
occupational education provider, and each board of cooperative educational
services (BOCES), shall prepare a plan describing the proposed occupational
education programs and activities the district or BOCES intends to carry out
during the next two-year planning period. Such plans shall be developed as part
of the local application submitted to the commissioner for the purpose of
qualifying for an allocation of Federal vocational education funds. (b) The format and information required in
such plans shall be specified from time to time by the commissioner. The plan
shall include, as a minimum, descriptions of the population to be served, specific description of activities to be carried out and the location of such
activities, the estimated enrollment of students in each activity, the proposed
amount of funds to be expended for each activity and a statement of expected
results. (c) School districts
receiving an apportionment of State aid pursuant to paragraph b of subdivision
17 of section
3602
of the

Education Law shall also include the following in their plans: (1)
specific goals to enhance occupational
education program expansion and/or improvement for all student
populations; (2)
strategies and
activities for the implementation of requirements of State occupational
education curriculum and testing programs; (3)
a description of the evaluation criteria
to be used to determine how well the program expansion and/or improvement goals
have been met; and
(4)
a
description of how local fiscal effort will be maintained through the
expenditure of local funds. (d) Such plans shall be submitted to the
commissioner every two years by a date prescribed by the commissioner, but in
no event later than September 1st of the first school year of the applicable
two-year planning period and the commissioner may require annual revisions
which shall be submitted to the commissioner by a date prescribed by the
commissioner. The initial two-year planning period shall commence on July 1, 1988, and every two school years subsequent to such date shall comprise a
two-year planning period. Notes
